snippet: A critic traces City Opera’s possible missteps — including dropping staged productions for one season and relocating to Lincoln Center decades ago — and some triumphs.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini notes seemingly sudden demise of New York City Opera is not surprising, given poor decisions made in last few years and fact that company was never really financially stable.
lead_paragraph: A critic traces City Opera’s possible missteps — including dropping staged productions for one season and relocating to Lincoln Center decades ago — and some triumphs.

headline.print_headline: A Plucky Opera’s Poignant Death Rattle
headline.seo: Tracing City Opera’s Missteps and Triumphs
headline.main: A Plucky Opera’s Poignant Death Rattle
